intro: Psilogramme canescens, commonly known as the grey psilogramme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Psilogramme canescens is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
